t: Assurance of God’s Victory over Enemies
A Song. A Psalm of David.
O*pn God, my heart is steadfast; I*ld will sing and give praise, even with my glory.
Awake,*ld lute and harp! I*ld will awaken the dawn.
I*ld will praise You, O Lord,*s among the peoples, And*ld I will sing praises to You among the nations.
For*ld Your mercy is*i great above the heavens, And*ld Your truth reaches*i to the clouds.
Be*ln exalted, O God, above the heavens, And*ld Your glory above all the earth;
That*ld Your beloved may be delivered, Save*ld with*i Your right hand, and hear me.
God*ln has spoken in His holiness: “I*ld will rejoice; I*ld will divide Shechem And*ld measure out the Valley of Succoth.
Gilead*ld is*i Mine; Manasseh is*i Mine; Ephraim*ld also is*i the helmet for My head; Judah*ld is*i My lawgiver.
Moab*ld is*i My washpot; Over*ld Edom I will cast My shoe; Over*ld Philistia I will triumph.”
Who*ln will bring me into*i the strong city? Who*ld will lead me to Edom?
Is*ild it*i not You,*i O God, who*i cast us off? And*ld You,*i O God, who*i did not go out with our armies?
Give*ld us help from trouble, For*ld the help of man is useless.
Through*ld God we will do valiantly, For*ld it*i is*i He who*i shall tread down our enemies.
